title: How to make your home a haven
text:
The Acoustibox $195

Inspired by Thomas Edison's phonograph, this enhances your phone's sound without electricity or cables. theacoustibox.com

Priscilla cushion by One Nine Eight Five £115

These rich tones add opulence to any room. onenineeightfive.co.uk

Chicken Feet quilt from The Mews Furnishings from £225

Cotton voile hand block-printed in India. themewsfurnishings.com

Ratio Six coffee machine $345

A sleek design to enhance your morning ritual. ratiocoffee.com

Slow Burn candle by Boy Smells $30

Inspired by Kacey Musgraves' song Slow Burn. boysmells.com

Owl and the pussycat hot water bottle by Row Pinto £72

Hand-knitted in Scottish lamb's wool, also available with a matching cushion. cockpitarts.com

The Bel by 3rd Ritual for &You £165

As the candle melts, the brass pins falls into the brass base, producing a beautiful sound. andyoulifestyle.com

Dial In milk pitcher by Barista Co from £19.99

baristaandco.com

Malachite domino set by Blue Carreon $285

An opulent take on a traditional game. bluecarreon.com

Bolster cushion by ISHKAR £150

Handmade by artisans in Myanmar, this vibrant design adds depth and warmth. ishkar.com

Chirp by Anden £45

In iroko or maple, this lets out a melodic birdcall when the vintage brass wingnut is turned. madebyanden.co.uk

Eden organic cotton towel by Sheridan from £3

Made with lyocell-wrapped cotton, perfect after a relaxing soak. sheridanaustralia.co.uk

Brass incense holder by Earl of East X Swarf Hardware £75

An elegant platform for lovely aromas in the home. earlofeast.com

Ella Lamp by Nocturne Workshop £250

Smart burgundy hue and brass detailing. artistsandobjects.com

Follow @FTProperty on Twitter or @ft_houseandhome on Instagram to find out about our latest stories first. Listen to our podcast, Culture Call, where FT editors and special guests discuss life and art in the time of coronavirus. Subscribe on Apple, Spotify, or wherever you listen.
